caption: (Translated by Google) Very. Beyo  (Original) Muy.  Beyo
Really great restaurant and shop! I got takeout for my quarantine birthday and they added a slice of almond lemon cake, free of charge. Great folks and great food.

Mola is a treasure and recently saved a virtual date night! Whether enjoyed at Mola (I look forward to returning) or at home with delivery, Mola’s food is always delicious. The owners are great, knowledgeable, and liberal with their sherry pours.
Spanish husband approved
Excellent food, fantastic service, great atmosphere.
Food and atmosphere were fantastic.
(Translated by Google) Good food.  (Original) Buena comida.

This has become my neighborhood spot. It's very tranquil (you can actually have conversations), good happy hour, nice food, and all the people who work here have been so friendly and unpretentious. Love that they do Thursday specials on women-owned wines. All in all, a great lil place
It is okay
(Translated by Google) It was great😻🥳👀👌🏽is a good service🇭🇳🇭🇳👀  (Original) Estuvo grandioso😻🥳👀👌🏽es un buen servicio🇭🇳🇭🇳👀
Overlooked gem with one of the best interior vibes in the area. Great place to celebrate, unwind, or bring visitors in town.

One of my favorite spots in DC! Great value happy hour, extremely friendly and helpful staff, quaint interior and an awesome seasonal menu with dishes that remind me of the small modern local restaurants I frequented in Northern Spain (particularly influenced by Basque, Catalan, and Galician cuisine) They have Estrella Galicia on tap!!

Over priced and under satisfying. My friend and I paid about $120 for two people and left hungry. There were very few people in the restaurant, so it felt awkward. The waitress seemed like she was trying to sell us plates instead of simply serving. I talked to a couple friends who were also very underwhelmed by their experience here. The interior design is nice to look at but not comfortable to be in because the seating is very hard wood with no cushions. The cheese appetizer was very good but the vegetarian platter was unsatisfying as a main dish. It's also served with minuscule flatbread. We had to go home and order pizza after this. My friend ordered a dish with fish, so more protein, but it still didn't fill her up.

Ladies birthday luncheon for nine was perfect thanks to the great food, bright and sleek interior, and exceptional service from Sarah and Chad. Couldn’t have been better. We’ve already got Mola on our calendar for a repeat event next year.
The staff are friendly and the food is great.
great food, service and atmosphere!
(Translated by Google) Very expensive is priceless the menu scares you in the end  (Original) Muy  caro no tiene  precio los menú lo asustan al final
A nice place with excellent food.

Truly one of the best dining experiences I have ever had anywhere. Every item was a flavor journey and palate explosion. The owner Mickey is a wonderful host and our server Nicole was the best. Highlight was the sherry tasting experience. Please give thia place a try. You won't be disappointed.

Intimate dining spot - great for a date. Nice decor and adequate light.  Cocktails were good and well presented. The flamenquins were absolutely fantastic. The food was perfectly done, well proportioned and it was really fun to try it all and try something a little different.  Highly recommend the eggplant dish - it's what the fish in fish and chips wishes it could be - Amazing! And the onions/pepper with it perfectly complemented it.
Service was a little slow but the food was incredible

Fantastic Spanish food in a small row house restaurant. Reserve in advance. Super cocktails. Another fine establishment (Purple Patch - Filipino food) next door has a lively basement bar if you want a drink after. Lots of other bars and restaurants in neighborhood.
Our favorite neighborhood spot. Try their olives and special wine drink!!!

Went for unlimited tapas, which happens every Monday. I loved how organically the (very delicious) food came out to the buffet. The server/bartender was so friendly and funny and helpful. It felt like being at a friend's home. There was also live music! This was a great value and I highly recommend it.

Very nice neighborhood restaurant. Appetizers are classic Spanish tapas. Unlimited mimosas means just that. Ate brunch there and they featured egg dishes with a nice Spanish edge to them. Service was friendly and attentive without being overbearing. My Pleasant needs more places on this.
Great service and fabulous food!
Mola Mondays featured an all you can eat Tapas Buffet and $7 vermouth bar. Excellent spread and service
Bad food and highly priced
Savvy brunch spot; ownership has great attention to detail from the menu to service. Unfortunately we found it a week prior to moving. Must visit. Coffee on point.

Very cute space ideal for a 2 or 3 people date ... Mostly ideal for romantic dates. They have a great happy hour and small bites options. But also, full entre meals. The staff is very friendly and most of the local Mt pleasant, Columbia heights and Park view neighborhood folks go there to unwind.  The music is soft and the ambiance is mold and happy.
Great place, kind of felt they were rushing us although they didn't close for 45 minutes.

Really outstanding restaurant. It's honestly the only place I've been that treated Spanish food as a cuisine instead of just "tapas". Their menu includes numerous authentic, and many inspired dishes that combine multiple flavors into a very balanced and fulfilling experience. It's easy for a restaurant to get savory, sweet, bitter, and other palettes right. It's much more difficult to combine or contrast flavors, and even more difficult to match them and bring the dish to the next level. That's what this food is, next level. It has been a consistently positive experience every time we come. The service is attentive and warm. The atmosphere, welcoming and restrained. It's a small place, but it's easy to get lost and let the hours go by. Their regular menu is reasonably priced, especially for the quality of the food you receive and their happy hour is a steal. Regardless of time or day, I'd recommend you to go and experience some of the best food, and best restaurants in the District.
Great wine and food.  Spsnish tapas, paella!  Yum!
Ambiance was nice but the food was dull and I got a bottle cap in one of my drinks.
Amazing pallea, amazing service will be back for more paella yum yum
(Translated by Google) How delicious the black squid rice!  (Original) Que rico el arroz negro de calamar!
mom works there and i have the best days when i go there i love the thing called corketas
Very laid back. Awesome bartender. Had a drink with a friend. Can’t wait to be back to test the good.

Really great restaurant. The food is great, the atmosphere is great, and the service we had was fantastic. I can't recommend it enough. My girlfriend and I came here for a romantic date and we were very impressed.
(Translated by Google) Sensational :)  (Original) Sensacional :)
For the prices the dishes were really small and uneven the other table got a bigger portion of the same dishes I ordered. Another variety of drinks wouldn't be bad.
Delicious food, great happy hour!
Such an adorable and quaint spot for happy hour!
Excellent addition to the neighborhood!

One of the best restaurants I have had the pleasure of dining at in DC. Service was impeccable. Not only was our server Jessica extremely professional and helpful when describing dishes I had never tried but the help she received from her colleague from the bar was awesome. Constant attention to customers, without being to intrusive. The food was spectacular. Everything we tried was amazing and fresh. Perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection. The only complaint I had was I was not able to try the entire menu due to my stomach not being big enough! Will definitely be back to try more of the dishes. Oh and to top it off they received a bib gourmand! I have no affiliation to this place but highly recommend the community support Mola and the staff there. Almost forgot about the wine, 10/10 would buy another bottle. You will not be disappointed!

Anyone who rates this less than 5 stars is dumb or did not order the fried goat cheese. This place is nothing short of amazing. All of the food and drink are some of the best we have had in DC, and the service was incredible. Our waiter Uri was the friendliest, most honest waiter we have had in a while. Will 100% be coming back.

Love this small neighborhood spot! I'm a huge fan of their happy hour; tons of food options and wine offerings are above average. I usually sit at the bar but this is a great spot for a dinner date as well. Service is always friendly and attentive.

A good friend took me for brunch here this weekend and I was unexpectedly and pleasantly surprised by the sheer quality of the cooking.  Once they'd sorted out the faulty speaker and overloud music we relaxed into the friendly warm service and selected a number of small tapas plates to share and, honestly, I could have kept going and going.  All the food is lovingly hand cooked and presented. The ham croquetas were incredible, hot and golden just salty enough and resting in a wonderful green sauce. The Torrijas (cinnamon & orange flavoured French toast with orange blossom honey) was mouth-wateringly delicious and the Fried Goat Cheese with orange-blossom honey & dried plums was other-worldly.  Mola turned a grey and rainy Saturday into a warm, cozy, yummy weekend.

All of our food was great. Tasty & good portions to share. However, they were out of half of their menu items & even some wine. Server was sweet, but she was the only person covering the dining room. Good, but could be a lot better.
Mola is AMAZING! Fantastically unique cocktails paired with traditional spanish favorites. Plus, the happy hour is on point and ends at 7:30 pm.  Highly recommend the patatas bravas!
One of my favorite places to go in Mt. Pleasant.
Great happy hour in a stunningly sweet spot!

The paella was super delicious, but for $40 (not including tip) I really expected twice the volume. I split it with my girlfriend and we both thought we’d get more food for the money we spent on it. I don’t know if I’d try this place again.

Really liked the food. True Spanish flavours and well presented. Try the cocas, perfect to be eaten as shareable tapas! The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because the Mahou beer was hot as broth (and we specifically ordered it VERY cold).

Mount Pleasant is severely underrated with a gem like Mola here. I have been here 4 times and everything in the menu transports me back to Barcelona. The waiters are always nice and attentive and the food is great and much more affordable than stuffy downtown places that are not even at the food level of Mola.
Visited during the end of Sunday brunch. Mola has a charming interior complimented by great food and service. It was reasonably priced to boot! I will definitely be visiting Mola again.
Great flavors, well done.
Delicious small plates in a very comfortable, welcoming atmosphere. This place is a neighborhood gem.
Great ambiance and nice, cozy seating. Excellent selection of Sherry’s. And reasonably priced tapas for an evening out

This is a cozy and romantic feel while visiting Mola. It feels like you’re eating delicious Spanish food inside of an actual house. It beautiful decorated.  I had the honey fried goat cheese and plums. Very rich and delicious. I enjoyed the Patatas Bravos with over easy eggs. The chili sauce was just the right addition to bring in the flavors of the fried potatoes and eggs.

I've gone to Mola for dinner a few times with friends, and we've always been pleased with the service, atmosphere and food. Per D.C. standard, we ordered a handful of small plates and shared. I'd suggest going with four people.  Friends and I have also gone to Mola's happy hours somewhat regularly and are always pleased with the offerings. The space is adorable but the bar can fill up quickly if you're going with more than one or two other people.

Went here twice while staying in DC. It's small and very quaint. Servers are very sweet but very slow. And it's not a huge menu, so if you aren't up for what they specifically have..you won't be satisfied. I left feeling content, but then my belly rumbles an hour after I ate. Hmm. Drinks are ok, but great wine selection. Not sure I'd go back, but it was definitely not a bad meal. Just not my style, too slow and not enough options regarding food.
Great food, friendly and attentive staff.  Brunch was spectacular!
Great food and drinks, great ambiance. A lot of beautiful details go into this restaurant and the food they serve.
The quality of the food is excellent. I highly recommend the Catalan black rice!
(Translated by Google) Too bad not working in this restaurant very good food  (Original) Lastima el no trabajar en este restaurante muy buena comida

No bucket of ice for the cava, it wasn't even that cold to begin with. Food was good, but not great. Ambiance was nice. I had a good time overall. It's just that if you serve cava or any sparkling wine, a bucket of ice please.
Great food, nice ambiance, great service

Loved everything about this place. The decor is chic and charming, the menu is creative and well-balanced with lots of vegetarian options, and the service is excellent. We ordered four dishes, with help from the servers, and the timing and order of service were very thoughtful. The cauliflower, spinach ends, and eggplant were amazing, and the mackerel was less so but still tasty. I look forward to returning soon to try other menu items!
Loved the unique and flavorful food and the timing of each dish made for a terrific dining experience. Highly recommend!
Homie place for Spanish fare that balances simple ingredients in creative flavors.
I have only had drinks, verano, gin and tonic, and a draft Mahou beer. Everything good, also one digit. Would come back to try the food another time.
Food was good but overpriced, drinks ok, probably won't go back.

Food was fantastic and the restaurant is bright and cheery (a welcome renovation from Radius which previously occupied the space). Service was very good, with excellent recommendations. Menu selection was great. Deserving of 4.5 stars.
Their meat- and veggie-rich paella is very tasty!
The food is amazing. This is a place where it doesn't matter what you get on the menu...you will be delighted.

After dining at Nido's and now Mola, I think I know what it takes to open a successful restaurant: 1) Focus on a small, fresh menu and master each dish creating art with food, 2) Cultivate an eye for design and lighting, 3) Train your staff in being pleasant, putting diners at ease, and 4) Ask for feedback along the way. The owners of Mola can teach a class on this.  Mola is a Spanish/Moroccan restaurant in Mount Pleasant NW. Once inside, you'll be greeted by a pleasant host before being seated in dining area. The design is simple, inviting, and their floral logo is genius. Fun fact: The owner, Carlos, made all the wooden furniture himself.  There's a full bar in the back and to the left of the bar is a five person "bar nook." They intentionally don't have heavy alcohol cocktails but rather offer more light drinks like the Tinto de Verano (red wine and limonata).  Their menu has fourteen items on it ranging from snacks to a large pot of paella. It's simple but that only means they have perfected each dish. We (my wife and I) ordered one snack sized dish, two medium dishes and the paella and we were satisfied. Here's what we ordered that we will have us running back for:  1) Pork, sausage, chickpea, and spinach paella: It comes in a large pot perfectly fried with the best oil. They make sure they slightly burn the rice on the bottom giving you an extra treat. Truly, the flavors are perfect.  2) Fried goat cheese with honey and beer chips.  3) Sherried artichokes with egg, herbs and pine nut sauce: The artichoke is perfectly cooked and never chewy.  We didn't get dessert, but we hear it's amazing so we'll be back!
